thread.title: San Francisco Airport terminal cleared, suspicious package found
thread.title_full: San Francisco Airport terminal cleared, suspicious package found

title: San Francisco Airport terminal cleared, suspicious package found
text:
San Francisco Airport terminal cleared, suspicious package found Last updated 09:41, August 25 2015 @chessninja/TWITTER 
San Francisco International Airport shut down when a toy hand grenade was found in luggage. 
Passengers at San Francisco International Airport were cleared from a terminal after inoperable toy hand grenades were discovered in a suspicious package. 
Airport officials sent out a Twitter message informing the public that the terminal was being cleared. 
Police removed the package and reopened the security checkpoint in the terminal. SFO terminal 2 security checkpoint just shut down and evacuated, everyone told to go outside. Lots of security jogging around. — Mig Greengard (@chessninja) August 23, 2015 We were five people away from going through, of course. — Mig Greengard (@chessninja) August 23, 2015 Guy who told everyone to go outside said not to worry, that "no planes would be leaving." Hmm. — Mig Greengard (@chessninja) August 23, 2015 Outside the evacuated Terminal 2 at SFO. Rumor is reopening in 20 min. Nobody official talking to crowd. pic.twitter.com/WdEjO93B8R — Mig Greengard (@chessninja) August 23, 2015 
Ticket counters inside the terminal remained open while the package was cleared. 
Passengers were rerouted to another boarding area for screening, airport spokesman Doug Yakel said in an email. 
Airport duty manager Jeff Figone said the toy grenades may have been purchased elsewhere by an airport visitor attempting to move them through. . @flySFO Terminal 2 shut down, ppl not allowed in. Emergency vehicles outside. Reason is not clear. Cc: @nbcbayarea pic.twitter.com/McJFp07vbb — Stephanie Chuang (@StephChuang) August 23, 2015 
"Fortunately, the system worked, and they were discovered and handled without incident," Figone said. 
TNS
